channel.title: Comments on: Eat, Drink, Play with Explosives

item.title: By: Roman Levin
item.dc:creator: Roman Levin
item.description: Also, Merc - you are completly ignorant of what a socialist government is.
item.content:encoded: Also, Merc – you are completly ignorant of what a socialist government is.

item.title: By: Mark Wallace
item.dc:creator: Mark Wallace
item.description: lol, I certainly don't think WoW should be socialist. I'm all for more auction houses. Although I also think it's kind of cool that IF is like the Wall Street of Azeroth.
item.content:encoded: lol, I certainly don’t think WoW should be socialist. I’m all for more auction houses. Although I also think it’s kind of cool that IF is like the Wall Street of Azeroth.

item.title: By: Hyd
item.dc:creator: Hyd
item.description: I'm with Roman - wouldn't it be nice if they had AH terminals in the larger towns that reflected the nearest auction house? FFXI could manage it, and there isn't a more player-unfriendly game out there than FFXI.
item.content:encoded: I’m with Roman – wouldn’t it be nice if they had AH terminals in the larger towns that reflected the nearest auction house? FFXI could manage it, and there isn’t a more player-unfriendly game out there than FFXI.

item.title: By: Merc
item.dc:creator: Merc
item.description: yeah, wow should be socialist. All characters should b exactly the same. Perhaps the wow socialist government should randomly take items out of your inventory and give them to others.
item.content:encoded: yeah, wow should be socialist. All characters should b exactly the same. Perhaps the wow socialist government should randomly take items out of your inventory and give them to others.

item.title: By: Roman Levin
item.dc:creator: Roman Levin
item.description: That's bullshit. It's simply because of the auction house. If all mobs would have been in a single place it would have been much laggier than Ironforge. Adding some additional auction houses that work on the same network would greatly ease the lag.
item.content:encoded: That’s bullshit. It’s simply because of the auction house. If all mobs would have been in a single place it would have been much laggier than Ironforge. Adding some additional auction houses that work on the same network would greatly ease the lag.

item.title: By: Mark Wallace
item.dc:creator: Mark Wallace
item.description: Also American: Doesn't it strike you that the laggiest place in Azeroth--Ironforge--is also the most commercial? Kind of an interesting statement about the people in WoW: the thing they're (we're) most interested in is making money. All those cool quests and colorful mobs just can't keep 'em away from the auction house.
item.content:encoded: Also American: Doesn’t it strike you that the laggiest place in Azeroth–Ironforge–is also the most commercial? Kind of an interesting statement about the people in WoW: the thing they’re (we’re) most interested in is making money. All those cool quests and colorful mobs just can’t keep ’em away from the auction house.
